definitions.definition: to destroy something by twisting it with force or tearing it into pieces so that its original form is completely changed:
examples: My sweater got mangled in the washing machine.

definitions.definition: If you mangle a speech or a piece of written work, you make so many mistakes that you completely spoil it:
examples: As he read the poem out loud, he mangled the rhythm so badly that it hardly made any sense.

definitions.definition: a machine used for pressing water out of clothes by putting the clothes between two heavy, smooth, round bars
